poem:
"Easter Abject and Resplendent" 

Chococo's offering, a deep azure orb,
Impregnated with Dorset salt-caramel,
Deserving of jubilant tongues: five starred.
Beside, a pallid lamb, flat, holds less charm,
Betty's 2D creation leaves us perturbed,
Like an ebbing tide, or a sun obscured.
Pondering this, austere in my kitchen,
Finding beauty even in confection's division.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Easter egg taste test: will our baking queen love them to bits? BEST BUYChococo sapphire milk chocolate egg with Dorset sea salt caramel gems£20, 250g, chococo.co.uk This is a very good egg; really pretty, thick, good chocolate, a surprise inside – really good, salty caramels! I don’t know what I would improve.★★★★★ Betty’s white chocolate spring lamb flat egg£13.75, 130g, bettys.co.uk Not sure how I feel about 2D eggs. Where’s the rest of it?! So". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
